name: zigbee2mqtt
description: Zigbee2MQTT is a self-hosted bridge that connects Zigbee devices to MQTT, enabling integration with many home automation platforms. It runs as a service with a web dashboard for managing devices and networks.
features: Device pairing: Add Zigbee devices to your network through a simple web interface without proprietary hubs.
MQTT bridge: Expose Zigbee devices to MQTT topics for integration with Home Assistant, Node-RED, and other platforms.
Device management: Configure, rename, and remove devices with detailed information about capabilities and status.
Network visualization: View your Zigbee network topology with signal strength and routing information.
OTA updates: Update device firmware over-the-air directly through the interface when manufacturers release updates.
Group control: Create device groups to control multiple lights or switches simultaneously with one command.
Binding support: Set up direct device-to-device communication for faster response times and offline operation.
Extensive compatibility: Support thousands of Zigbee devices from hundreds of manufacturers with regular updates.
Custom converters: Add support for new or unsupported devices by writing JavaScript converter definitions.
Logging and debugging: Access detailed logs for troubleshooting device issues and network problems.
Backup and restore: Export network configuration and device settings for easy migration or disaster recovery.
Touchlink support: Reset and pair devices using Touchlink commissioning for devices without reset buttons.
